alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing an anilide group in which the carboxamide group is substituted with an aromatic group. They have the general structure RNC(=O)R', where R= benzene, and R = aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic anilides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a fluorene moiety, which consists of two benzene rings connected through either a cyclopentane, cyclopentene, or cyclopenta-1,3-diene.
alternative_parents.name: Fluorenes

alternative_parents.description: Naphthalene derivatives carrying one or more hydroxyl (-OH) groups at any ring position.
alternative_parents.name: Naphthols and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a 2-hydroxybenzoic acid moiety or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Salicylic acid and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds that contain a ketone group substituted at one C-atom with an aryl group. They have the generic structure RC(=O)R', where R = aryl group and R'=organyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl ketones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one or more chlorine atoms attached to a benzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Chlorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a fatty acid moiety linked to an amine group through an ester linkage.
alternative_parents.name: N-acyl amines

alternative_parents.description: Alpha,beta-unsaturated ketones that carry a branch on the alpha carbon. They have the generic structure RC(=O)C(R')=C, R = organyl group and R'= any heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha-branched alpha,beta-unsaturated ketones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a hydroxyl group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the enone functional group, with the structure RC(=O)CR'.
alternative_parents.name: Enones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acryloyl functional group (which has the core fragment but-3-en-2-one).
alternative_parents.name: Acryloyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of diazene(diimide), HN=NH, wherein both hydrogens are substituted by hydrocarbyl groups, e.g. PhN=NPh azobenzene or diphenyldiazene.
alternative_parents.name: Azo compounds

alternative_parents.description: Vinyl halides in which a chlorine atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Vinyl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds derived from an alkene by replacing a hydrogen atom with a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Chloroalkenes

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives containing a carbonyl group in which the carbon atom is linked to a nitrogen atom (substituted or not). The general formula of the carboxylic acid amide is R1C(=O)N(R2)R3 (R1,R2,R3=H, alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Compounds containing a naphthalene moiety, which consists of two fused benzene rings.
class.name: Naphthalenes

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as naphthalene-2-carboxanilides. These are naphthalene-2-carboxamides, where the carboxamide group is substituted with an aniline.

direct_parent.description: Naphthalene-2-carboxamides, where the carboxamide group is substituted with an aniline.
direct_parent.name: Naphthalene-2-carboxanilides

intermediate_nodes.description: Compounds containing a naphthalene moiety, which bears a carboxylic acid amide group at one or more positions. Naphthalene is a bicyclic compound that is made up of two fused benzene rings.
intermediate_nodes.name: Naphthalenecarboxamides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing a naphthalene moiety, which bears a carboxylic acid group or a derivative at one or more positions. Naphthalene is a bicyclic compound that is made up of two fused benzene ring.
subclass.name: Naphthalenecarboxylic acids and derivatives

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
